intro: Eudema glebaria, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species adapted to dry environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically narrow and succulent to reduce water loss. Eudema glebaria thrives in sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. It is a hardy perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
